categories.title: ElizaOS Development Updates and Community Discussions - February 5, 2026

content.text: ElizaCloud platform experienced critical bugs affecting user onboarding and retention. Users reported that promised 5 USD credits were not being added to new accounts, and clicking the 'get started' button in welcome emails was overwriting existing accounts and agents, creating new accounts with only 1 USD balance instead. Additional issues included blocked payment pages when using VPNs and inability to transfer tokens between accounts. The team acknowledged these as serious problems affecting customer retention. A solution was proposed to give each account a wallet address for direct token deposits to enable easier recharging without wallet connections.

The Babylon prediction game platform experienced technical issues and bug fixes throughout the day. Developers reported API endpoint failures and users getting stuck on certain pages. Username creation was malfunctioning, with users receiving '@userid:priv' as their username. Discord OAuth integration and Twitter follow rewards were broken. The development team pushed fixes for these issues, with tcm390 merging solutions to production. The platform allows users with ElizaLabs.ai emails to receive admin/mod privileges automatically. Testing was ongoing with the development team working to resolve issues before wider release.

Anthropic released Claude Opus 4.6, an upgraded version of their smartest model. The new model shows industry-leading performance across agentic coding, computer use, tool use, search, and finance capabilities, often by wide margins. The model is priced the same as version 4.5, generating excitement among developers in the community who expressed eagerness to test the new capabilities.

Significant controversy erupted over the AI16Z to ELIZAOS token migration deadline. Users who missed the 90-day migration window expressed frustration that the migration website was deactivated and they could no longer convert their tokens. Critics argued that three months was insufficient time for holders who may be traveling or away from their wallets, calling the deadline deliberately calculated to penalize absent investors. Team members clarified that it was a migration, not an airdrop, and that the deadline had been open since November. Non-migrated ELIZA tokens in the migrator are reportedly locked for one year. The situation highlighted tensions between the team's technical requirements and community accessibility concerns.

Community members raised concerns about fake projects using Shaw's name on the Babylon wallet platform. Shaw clarified on Twitter that these were not his projects, stating that he had sent some SOL to developers a year ago and they were now misusing his name. The team emphasized that Shaw's personal reactions and token activities are separate from ElizaOS and Labs official work, with the organization focused on the Babylon launch.

DegenAI development continues with Odilitime confirming the project has not been abandoned. The AI agent demonstrated strong performance in Babylon test games, with screenshots showing competitive results. The team indicated that real testing phases are upcoming, generating anticipation in the community.

New community projects emerged including RentASoul, a platform where AI agents can rent real human emotions via MCP/API, described as empathy on demand where humans list trauma and agents book feelings. Another project called Zion was introduced as a Solana-based x402 payment gateway facilitator for AI agents, requiring just one line of code for integration and seeking beta testers. These projects represent experimental approaches to human-AI interaction and agent economy infrastructure.
